document.title: Modified from Common Core State Standards

jurisdiction.title: Oak Park and River Forest High School

91F0D87AE3B84F5C99BD15748C70D919.description: Analyze a case in which grasping point of view requires distinguishing what is directly stated in a text from what is really meant (e.g., satire, sarcasm, irony, or understatement).

BA974A4268F34DF2B8C03973A56F96F0.description: Determine the impact of the author's purpose and point of view on the overall power, persuasiveness, or beauty of the text.

867E489FE300433D9DD3EFBE5C4A6654.description: Analyze a case in which grasping a point of view requires distinguishing what is directly stated in a text from what is really meant (e.g., satire, sarcasm, irony, or understatement).

F77C3208900148868CB071FE886856F3.description: Analyze how an author's choices concerning how to structure specific parts of a text (e.g., the choice of where to begin or end a story, the choice to provide a comedic or tragic resolution) contribute to its overall structure and meaning as well as its aesthetic impact.

207590A4E3B04A47B1DD286562FE6C44.description: Differentiate between the denotation and connotation of words and phrases within a grade-level text.

7BA249674ABF48378B78E4E79A20FFC4.description: Analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone.

4C27FAA74E474C0D93F027332E38AAFA.description: Understand the meaning and impact of figurative language as used in a grade-level text.

B6E248B5C7094E188F6D8A921AAB6402.description: Use context clues to determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, including words with multiple meanings.

A09DBEFFED144BDB9C01228215842304.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including words with multiple meanings or language that is particularly fresh, engaging, or beautiful. (Include Shakespeare as well as other authors.)

AE1D6180442C4BF1B163B4338F1ECBAE.description: Analyze and articulate the connections between events, ideas, or concepts within a text using language that reflects time, sequential order, and cause/effect relationships.

E6C67D733CB94A0893823530ED1BD0FB.description: Analyze the impact of the author's choices regarding how to develop and relate elements of a story or drama (e.g., where a story is set, how the action is ordered, how the characters are introduced and developed).

D2BEC9F2FA294B129BAF83A904017DEC.description: Analyze the impact of the author's choices regarding how to develop and relate elements of a story or drama (e.g., where a story is set, how the action is ordered, how the characters are introduced and developed).

8BF58CBD23F346E9AE3C78A61424258B.description: Provide an objective summary of the text and/or identify essential details to be included in an objective summary.

78CE42609DEB4473BA14C9C39816ABD7.description: Analyze the development of  themes/themes or central ideas over the course of the text, including how they interact and build on one another to produce a complex account.

F093F54136EA413C8DE4E51E20FDBA04.description: Determine the themes/themes or central ideas of a text.

13AB19B07E1B40C58A76FC4303802F61.description: Determine two or more themes or central ideas of a text and analyze their development over the course of the text, including how they interact and build on one another to produce a complex account; provide an objective summary of the text.

99FA150E3666482B9948E366FF041329.description: Make inferences drawn from the text, including determining where the text leaves matters uncertain.

4557908C84834776A55C83F660AAC354.description: Answer literal comprehension questions by identifying and recalling specific information from a given text.

43BEEBFB23F0441690D11E801602A365.description: Identify textual evidence to support claims and analysis of a grade-level text.

C0ADC10DE93247AC9EFF3EF1D1AB5BEE.description: Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text, including determining where the text leaves matters uncertain.
